turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 14th Street station (IRT Third Avenue Line).
turn.1: What is the IRT Third Avenue Line?
turn.2: 14th Street station (IRT Third Avenue Line) 14th Street was a local station on New York's demolished IRT Third Avenue Line.
turn.3: What can you tell me about the 14th Street station?
turn.6: The lower level was served by local trains and had two tracks and two side platforms.
turn.7: Why was there a lower level?
turn.10: The upper level was built as part of the Dual Contracts and had one track that bypassed the station and served express trains.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: In 1924, the Brooklyn–Manhattan Transit Corporation built the 14th Street-Eastern District Line Subway below the station, which included the Third Avenue subway station.
